intro: Centaurium phenax, commonly known as the lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. Centaurium phenax is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
